fields.name: MultiRequests
fields.description: /** Create the given number of sync requests each with an upsert to articles */

fields.name: std_Echo
fields.description: /** Echos the given parameter to assure the database is working appropriately. */

fields.name: std_Delay
fields.description: /** A command that completes after a specified number of milliseconds. */

fields.name: std_Containers
fields.description: /** List all database containers */

fields.name: std_Messages
fields.description: /** List all database commands and messages */

fields.name: std_Schema
fields.description: /** Return the Schema assigned to the database */

fields.name: std_Stats
fields.description: /** Return the number of entities of all containers (or the given container) of the database */

fields.name: std_Host
fields.description: /** Returns general information about the Hub like version, host, project and environment name */

fields.name: std_Cluster
fields.description: /** List all databases and their containers hosted by the Hub */

fields.name: std_User
fields.description: /** Return the groups of the current user. Optionally change the groups of the current user */

fields.name: std_Client
fields.description: /** Return client specific infos and adjust general client behavior like **queueEvents** */

types.name: PocStore
types.description:
/**
 * The **PocStore** offer two functionalities:   
 * 1. Defines a database **schema** by declaring its containers, commands and messages  
 * 2. Is a database **client** providing type-safe access to its containers, commands and messages   
 */

fields.name: articles2
fields.description: /** ensure multiple containers can use same entity Type */

types.name: DbSchema
types.description:
/**
 * A **DbSchema** can be assigned to a database to specify its **containers**, **commands** and **messages**.  
 * The types used by the Schema are declared within **jsonSchemas**.  
 * The type referenced by the tuple **schemaName** / **schemaPath** specify the
 * database containers, commands and messages.
 */

fields.name: id
fields.description: /** database name */

fields.name: schemaName
fields.description: /** refer a type definition of the JSON Schema referenced with **schemaPath** */

fields.name: schemaPath
fields.description: /** refer a JSON Schema in **jsonSchemas** */

fields.name: jsonSchemas
fields.description:
/**
     * map of **JSON Schemas** each containing a set of type definitions.  
     * Each JSON Schema is identified by its unique path
     */

types.name: DbSchemaInput
types.description:
/**
 * A **DbSchema** can be assigned to a database to specify its **containers**, **commands** and **messages**.  
 * The types used by the Schema are declared within **jsonSchemas**.  
 * The type referenced by the tuple **schemaName** / **schemaPath** specify the
 * database containers, commands and messages.
 */

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: /** database name */

inputFields.name: schemaName
inputFields.description: /** refer a type definition of the JSON Schema referenced with **schemaPath** */

inputFields.name: schemaPath
inputFields.description: /** refer a JSON Schema in **jsonSchemas** */

inputFields.name: jsonSchemas
inputFields.description:
/**
     * map of **JSON Schemas** each containing a set of type definitions.  
     * Each JSON Schema is identified by its unique path
     */

fields.description:
/**
     * the color used to display the environment name in GUI's using CSS color format.  
     * E.g. using red for a production environment: "#ff0000" or "rgb(255 0 0)"
     */

fields.name: pubSub
fields.description: /** is true if host support Pub-Sub. */

fields.name: routes
fields.description: /** routes configures by **HttpHost** - commonly below /fliox */

fields.name: ensureClientId
fields.description: /** Return the client id set in **SyncRequest** or creates a new one in case is was not set. */

fields.name: queueEvents
fields.description:
/**
     * If **false** the hub try to send events to a client when the events are emitted.
     * Sending events to a disconnected client will never arrive.   
     * If **true** the hub will store all unacknowledged events for a client in a FIFO queue and send them on reconnects.
     */

inputFields.name: ensureClientId
inputFields.description: /** Return the client id set in **SyncRequest** or creates a new one in case is was not set. */

inputFields.name: queueEvents
inputFields.description:
/**
     * If **false** the hub try to send events to a client when the events are emitted.
     * Sending events to a disconnected client will never arrive.   
     * If **true** the hub will store all unacknowledged events for a client in a FIFO queue and send them on reconnects.
     */

fields.name: queueEvents
fields.description: /** returns true if the host queue events for the client in case of disconnects */

fields.name: queuedEvents
fields.description:
/**
     * return number of queued events not acknowledged by the client.
     * Events are queued only if the client instruct the Hub to queue events by setting **queueEvents** = true
     */

fields.name: clientId
fields.description:
/**
     * return the client id set in the **SyncRequest**. Can be null.  
     * A new client id is created in case any task requires a client id and the **SyncRequest** did not set a client id.  
     * E.g. **ensureClientId** = true or **queueEvents** = true
     */

fields.name: subscriptionEvents
fields.description: /** number of sent or queued client events and its message and change subscriptions */

inputFields.name: queueEvents
inputFields.description: /** returns true if the host queue events for the client in case of disconnects */

inputFields.name: queuedEvents
inputFields.description:
/**
     * return number of queued events not acknowledged by the client.
     * Events are queued only if the client instruct the Hub to queue events by setting **queueEvents** = true
     */

inputFields.name: clientId
inputFields.description:
/**
     * return the client id set in the **SyncRequest**. Can be null.  
     * A new client id is created in case any task requires a client id and the **SyncRequest** did not set a client id.  
     * E.g. **ensureClientId** = true or **queueEvents** = true
     */

inputFields.name: subscriptionEvents
inputFields.description: /** number of sent or queued client events and its message and change subscriptions */

types.name: SubscriptionEvents
types.description: /** number of sent or queued client events and its message and change subscriptions */

fields.name: seq
fields.description: /** number of events sent to a client */

fields.name: queued
fields.description: /** number of queued events not acknowledged by a client */

fields.name: queueEvents
fields.description: /** true if client is instructed to queue events for reliable event delivery in case of reconnects */

fields.name: connected
fields.description: /** true if client is connected. Non remote client are always connected */

fields.name: endpoint
fields.description:
/**
     * The endpoint of the client events are sent to.  
     * E.g. ws:[::1]:52089 for WebSockets, udp:127.0.0.1:60005 for UDP or in-process
     */

fields.name: messageSubs
fields.description: /** message / command subscriptions of a client */

fields.name: changeSubs
fields.description: /** change subscriptions of a client */

types.name: ChangeType
types.description: /** Filter type used to specify the type of an entity change */

enumValues.name: create
enumValues.description: /** filter change events of created entities. */

enumValues.name: upsert
enumValues.description: /** filter change events of upserted entities. */

enumValues.name: merge
enumValues.description: /** filter change events of entity patches. */

enumValues.name: delete
enumValues.description: /** filter change events of deleted entities. */
